content:
FrameworkTemplate Class

In this Article

Enables the instantiation of a tree of FrameworkElement and/or FrameworkContentElement objects.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.Windows.Localizability(System.Windows.LocalizationCategory.NeverLocalize)]
[System.Windows.Markup.ContentProperty("VisualTree")]
public abstract class FrameworkTemplate : System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherObject, System.Windows.Markup.INameScope, System.Windows.Markup.IQueryAmbient

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherObject
  • FrameworkTemplate

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,

,
CheckAccess()

Dispatcher
,
VerifyAccess()

Constructors summary

FrameworkTemplate()

Initializes a new instance of the FrameworkTemplate class.

Properties summary

HasContent

Gets a value that indicates whether this template has optimized content.
IsSealed

Gets a value that indicates whether this object is in an immutable state so it cannot be changed.
Resources

Gets or sets the collection of resources that can be used within the scope of this template.
Template

Gets or sets a reference to the object that records or plays the XAML nodes for the template when the template is defined or applied by a writer.
VisualTree

Gets or sets the root node of the template.

Methods summary

FindName(String,FrameworkElement)

Finds the element associated with the specified name defined within this template.
LoadContent()

Loads the content of the template as an instance of an object and returns the root element of the content.
RegisterName(String,Object)

Registers a new name/object pair into the current name scope.
Seal()

Locks the template so it cannot be changed.
ShouldSerializeResources(XamlDesignerSerializationManager)

Returns a value that indicates whether serialization processes should serialize the value of the stem.Windows.FrameworkTemplate.Resources* property on instances of this class.
ShouldSerializeVisualTree()

Returns a value that indicates whether serialization processes should serialize the value of the stem.Windows.FrameworkTemplate.VisualTree* property on instances of this class.
UnregisterName(String)

Removes a name/object mapping from the XAML namescope.
ValidateTemplatedParent(FrameworkElement)

When overridden in a derived class, supplies rules for the element this template is applied to.

Explicit Interface Implementations summary

INameScope.FindName(String)

Returns an object that has the provided identifying name.
IQueryAmbient.IsAmbientPropertyAvailable(String)

Queries whether a specified ambient property is available in the current scope.

Constructors

  • FrameworkTemplate()

    Initializes a new instance of the FrameworkTemplate class.

    protected FrameworkTemplate ();

Properties

  • HasContent

    Gets a value that indicates whether this template has optimized content.

    public bool HasContent { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if this template has optimized content; otherwise, false.

  • IsSealed

    Gets a value that indicates whether this object is in an immutable state so it cannot be changed.

    public bool IsSealed { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      trueif this object is in an immutable state; otherwise, false.

  • Resources

    Gets or sets the collection of resources that can be used within the scope of this template.

    public System.Windows.ResourceDictionary Resources { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ResourceDictionary

      The resources that can be used within the scope of this template.

    Remarks

    XAML Property Element Usage

    <object>  
  <object.Resources>  
    oneOrMoreResourceElements  
  </object.Resources>  
</object>  
- or -   
<object>  
  <object.Resources>  
    <ResourceDictionary Source="externalDictionarySource"/>  
  </object.Resources>  
</object>

    XAML Values

    oneOrMoreResourceElements
    One or more resource elements. To be referenced later in either StaticResource Markup Extension or DynamicResource Markup Extension syntax in XAML, a resource element MUST have an x:Key attribute.

    <ResourceDictionary Source="externalDictionarySource"/>
    An external file that defines a ResourceDictionary.

  • Template

    Gets or sets a reference to the object that records or plays the XAML nodes for the template when the template is defined or applied by a writer.

    public System.Windows.TemplateContent Template { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • TemplateContent

      A reference to the object that records or plays the XAML nodes for the template.

  • VisualTree

    Gets or sets the root node of the template.

    public System.Windows.FrameworkElementFactory VisualTree { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • FrameworkElementFactory

      The root node of the template.

    Remarks

    XAML Property Element Usage

    <object>  
  <VisualTreeRootNode > VisualTreeNodeContents  
  </VisualTreeRootNode >  
</object>

    XAML Values

    VisualTreeRootNode
    A single XAML element as the immediate child of the FrameworkTemplate subclass. Templates must have a single root node. In order to generate a useful template, the element chosen as VisualTreeRootNode is expected to support a content model of its own, often a model that supports multiple child elements.

    VisualTreeNodeContents
    One or more elements that complete the intended template. If the element chosen as VisualTreeRootNode only supports a single child, then there can only be one element declared as VisualTreeNodeContents. It is also possible (though uncommon) to provide text content if the chosen VisualTreeRootNode supports a text content property.

Methods

  • FindName(String,FrameworkElement)

    Finds the element associated with the specified name defined within this template.

    public object FindName (string name, System.Windows.FrameworkElement templatedParent);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The string name.

    • templatedParent
      FrameworkElement

      The context of the FrameworkElement where this template is applied.

    Returns

    • Object

      The element associated with the specified name.

    Remarks

    For more information, see "XAML Namescopes in Styles and Templates" in WPF XAML Namescopes.

  • LoadContent()

    Loads the content of the template as an instance of an object and returns the root element of the content.

    public System.Windows.DependencyObject LoadContent ();

    Returns

    • DependencyObject

      The root element of the content. Calling this multiple times returns separate instances.

  • RegisterName(String,Object)

    Registers a new name/object pair into the current name scope.

    public void RegisterName (string name, object scopedElement);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The name to register.

    • scopedElement
      Object

      The object to be mapped to the provided name.

    Remarks

    For more information, see "XAML Namescopes in Styles and Templates" in WPF XAML Namescopes.

  • Seal()

    Locks the template so it cannot be changed.

    public void Seal ();
  • ShouldSerializeResources(XamlDesignerSerializationManager)

    Returns a value that indicates whether serialization processes should serialize the value of the stem.Windows.FrameworkTemplate.Resources* property on instances of this class.

    public bool ShouldSerializeResources (System.Windows.Markup.XamlDesignerSerializationManager manager);

    Parameters

    • manager
      XamlDesignerSerializationManager

      The XamlDesignerSerializationManager.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the stem.Windows.FrameworkTemplate.Resources* property value should be serialized; otherwise, false.

  • ShouldSerializeVisualTree()

    Returns a value that indicates whether serialization processes should serialize the value of the stem.Windows.FrameworkTemplate.VisualTree* property on instances of this class.

    public bool ShouldSerializeVisualTree ();

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the stem.Windows.FrameworkTemplate.VisualTree* property value should be serialized; otherwise, false.

  • UnregisterName(String)

    Removes a name/object mapping from the XAML namescope.

    public void UnregisterName (string name);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The name of the mapping to remove.

    Remarks

    For more information, see "XAML Namescopes in Styles and Templates" in WPF XAML Namescopes.

  • ValidateTemplatedParent(FrameworkElement)

    When overridden in a derived class, supplies rules for the element this template is applied to.

    protected virtual void ValidateTemplatedParent (System.Windows.FrameworkElement templatedParent);

    Parameters

    • templatedParent
      FrameworkElement

      The element this template is applied to.

    Remarks

    The base implementation specifies that the templated parent must be a non-null FrameworkElement.

Explicit Interface Implementations

  • INameScope.FindName(String)

    Returns an object that has the provided identifying name.

    object INameScope.FindName (string name);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The name identifier for the object being requested.

    Returns

    • Object

      The object, if found. Returns null if no object of that name was found.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the FrameworkTemplate instance is cast to an INameScope interface.

  • IQueryAmbient.IsAmbientPropertyAvailable(String)

    Queries whether a specified ambient property is available in the current scope.

    bool IQueryAmbient.IsAmbientPropertyAvailable (string propertyName);

    Parameters

    • propertyName
      String

      The name of the requested ambient property.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the requested ambient property is available; otherwise, false.
